reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: SAFE Seas: Safeguarding against and Addressing Fishers’ Exploitation at Sea. SAFE Seas

description.narrative: Advocacy for international labour standards, labour law, fundamental principles and rights at work (child labour, forced labour, non-discrimination in the workplace, freedom of association and collective bargaining); formalisation of informal work, occupational safety and health.

This award supports advocacy for international labor standards, labor law, fundamental principles and rights at work. More specifically, this includes The SAFE Seas project will combat forced labor and human trafficking on fishing vessels in Indonesia and the Philippines. By strengthening government enforcement capacity and deepening engagement among fishers, the private sector and civil society, SAFE S. The SAFE Seas project will combat forced labor and human trafficking on fishing vessels in Indonesia and the Philippines. By strengthening government enforcement capacity and deepening engagement among fishers, the private sector and civil society, SAFE Seas will help promote supply chains free of exploitative labor and a fair playing field for workers in the U.S. and around the world..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Quarterly disbursements by project. May include disbursements for: salary and benefits, travel and per diem, logistical expenses and other costs of delivering technical assistance.
